com.linecorp.armeria.client.retry

Class RetryingClientBuilder<T extends RetryingClientBuilder<T,U,I,O>,U extends RetryingClient<I,O>,I extends Request,O extends Response>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.linecorp.armeria.client.retry.RetryingClientBuilder<T,U,I,O>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of RetryingClientBuilder
    U - the type of the Client that this builder builds or decorates
    I - the type of outgoing Request of the Client
    O - the type of incoming Response of the Client
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RetryingHttpClientBuilder, RetryingRpcClientBuilder

    public abstract class RetryingClientBuilder<T extends RetryingClientBuilder<T,U,I,O>,U extends RetryingClient<I,O>,I extends Request,O extends Response>
extends Object
    Builds a new RetryingClient or its decorator function.

    • Method Detail

      • backoffSupplier

        public T backoffSupplier(Supplier<? extends Backoff> backoffSupplier)
        Sets the Supplier that provides a Backoff. The Backoff will be used to calculate next delay to retry when the RetryStrategy.shouldRetry(Request, Response) returns true.
        Returns:
        T to support method chaining.

      • defaultMaxAttempts

        public T defaultMaxAttempts(int defaultMaxAttempts)
        Sets the defaultMaxAttempts. When a client sets the Backoff and does not invoke the Backoff.withMaxAttempts(int), the client could retry infinitely in certain circumstance. This would prevent that situation. The value will be set by the Flags.DEFAULT_BACKOFF_MAX_ATTEMPTS, if the client dose not specify.
        Returns:
        T to support method chaining.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
